channel.title: no title defined yet bug when updating - Whonix 15 - during upgrade
channel.description:
I was updating in the command line, apt update && apt upgrade && apt full-upgrade
i had a pop up happen during the process with the following text:
``` ERROR: ############################################################################### ## whonixcheck script bug. ## No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition has been hit. ## Try again later. There is likely a solution for this problem. ## Please see Whonix News, Whonix Blog and Whonix User Help Forum. ## Please report this bug! ## ## who_ami: user ## identifier: ## exit_code: 126 ## error_cause: error_handler signal ERR detected with BASH_COMMAND: /usr/lib/helper-scripts/settings_echo ## ## Experts only: ## bash -x whonixcheck --verbose ## for verbose output. Clean the output and report to Whonix developers. ######################################################################### ```

item.title: no title defined yet bug when updating - Whonix 15 - during upgrade
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
userapp3:

/usr/lib/helper-scripts/settings_echo

Whonix 15 looks like.
Could be due to anon-shared-helper-scripts -> helper-scripts migration.
If this only happens during upgrade this can be safely ignored.

Read full topic
